image.altText: The facade of a medical research building.

props.synopsis: Seven years ago, cancer patients forced to travel overseas for proton therapy were promised an Australian-based service — but the project collapsed last year and is now at the centre of a multi-million-dollar lawsuit.

title.children: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32m lawsuit

image.altText: A tall white column with a bright light at the top in front of a blue sky, with silver piping underneath.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited decision for a Northern Water project has arrived — but it has come with environmental contention.

title.children: Flag planted for Upper Eyre's proposed $5 billion desalination plant

image.altText: A supermarket fresh food aisle

props.synopsis: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

title.children: Shoppers warned of grocery price rise as parasite hits crop production

image.altText: A young, dark-haired girl in a school uniform doing some colouring-in at a desk.

props.synopsis: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

title.children: Neighbour of manslaughter-accused mother heard 'loud screaming', court hears

image.altText: A man with a grey beard wearing a beanie

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old Victorian man who died while cave diving in South Australia's south-east has been described as "fastidious" and as having a dark sense of humour, as an internal investigation is launched into what led to his death.

title.children: Cave diver Gary Gibson remembered as investigation begins into death

image.altText: Darren Letton holds a chicken. He wears a navy and yellow polo shirt. He is standing in a chicken barn.

props.synopsis: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

title.children: Egg shortage becomes egg oversupply with farmers unable to sell product

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Two South Australian men are the first in the state to be found guilty after standing trial for charges arising from the major police operation.

title.children: Two SA men found guilty of charges arising from AN0M app

image.altText: A South Australian emergency ambulance on the road.

props.synopsis: Police say members of the public helped the 84-year-old woman after the alleged attack before she was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

title.children: Elderly woman allegedly assaulted in 'unprovoked' incident in Adelaide

image.altText: An image of three young people, two female and one male, looking at mobile phones. A bright pink background is behind them.

props.synopsis: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

title.children: What 17,000-plus young people think about the social media ban

image.altText: The Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre during a lockdown.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are "likely" to consider asking for the case against two teenagers charged over a stabbing — which sent an Adelaide shopping centre into lockdown — to be moved to an adult court.

title.children: Teens in court charged over Adelaide shopping centre stabbing

image.altText: A woman wearing a black blazer stands with her hands in front of her

props.synopsis: Hayley Brown says she almost lost her life at the hands of a long-term partner. She is now one of the first victim-survivors to join a statewide lived experience advisory network.

title.children: Domestic violence survivor shares 'failures in the system' to spark change

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An image of spiders' legs in the shape of the logo of an Adelaide high school is among several bizarre clues that have been released in the hope they could help police identify the person who is behind a series of threatening emails.

title.children: Bizarre spiders' leg threat to Adelaide school

image.altText: Screenshot of Starboard Maritime Intelligence webpage showing a satellite photo of the ocean with a red square around a tanker

props.synopsis: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

title.children: Satellite images show scale of China's Philippine Sea flotilla

image.altText: Woman in long blue dress smiles at camera in the doorway of her shop front

props.synopsis: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

title.children: Cyber shoplifters costing retailers thousands in 'friendly fraud'

image.altText: Prince Andrew, the Duke of York, dressed in a dark suit holds a hand over his head.

props.synopsis: MPs in the United Kingdom will investigate the Crown Estate, after revelations Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor — Queen Elizabeth II's second son — had not paid rent for two decades sparked outrage.

title.children: UK MPs launch inquiry into Crown Estate after Andrew revelations

image.altText: A dark shot with a close up of a hand.

props.synopsis: The Australian Telecommunications and Media Authority says scammers were able to manipulate the telco's systems to bypass required identity verification processes.

title.children: Telco Southern Phone fined $2.5m for breaching anti-scam laws

image.altText: Mitchell Starc smiles with captain Pat Cummins after winning the third Test against West Indies.

props.synopsis: The last time Australia played a Test with the pink ball, the brilliance of Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland turned the game into a farce.

title.children: The two hours in Kingston that should have England quaking at the Gabba

image.altText: A Qantas Boeing 737-800 aircraft is seen landing at Sydney Domestic Airport

props.synopsis: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

title.children: Typing error 'cascaded' into series of mistakes on Qantas flight

image.altText: Protesters carry a large sign calling China's new UK embassy a "spy base".

props.synopsis: Underneath central London cables carrying vital financial information run and soon China's new embassy, which has redacted floor plans, could sit atop them.

title.children: Mystery floor plans stoke espionage fears as UK faces its China reckoning

image.altText: A headshot of Imran Khan in front of a flag

props.synopsis: The imprisoned former Pakistani prime minister was visited by one of his sisters for the first time in weeks, providing an update on his health after rumours swirled about his wellbeing.

title.children: Imran Khan alive but suffering psychologically, his sister says

image.altText: An aerial photo of a high school carpark.

props.synopsis: The stabbing happened on the school grounds of Keysborough Secondary College about 3pm.

title.children: Police question staff member over stabbing of principal at Melbourne school

image.altText: Six members of rock band Foo Fighters stand side-by-side, smiling.

props.synopsis: Foo Fighters, one of the biggest bands in the world, will play just one small Australian city when they travel out here in January.

title.children: Foo Fighters will play one Australian show next month, in Launceston

image.altText: A man in an Akubra-style hat stands leaning on a radio as a boy sits near him.

props.synopsis: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

title.children: Weather, markets, mateship and more: The Country Hour turns 80

image.altText: A man in a black shirt and shorts walking on a footpath alongside a giant, painted Venezuelan flag mural

props.synopsis: As the United States mounts pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, nations in the Caribbean, South America and across the world are revealing where their support lies.

title.children: Who Venezuela's key allies and opponents are in the face of a US conflict

image.altText: A woman takes a picture on a silver mobile phone

props.synopsis: New Delhi wants a government app installed on all of the country's mobile phones, but opposition MPs and privacy advocates have voiced concerns about surveillance.

title.children: 'Big Brother cannot watch us': Indian government phone app plan sparks outrage

image.altText: Lindy Lucena

props.synopsis: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

title.children: Watchdog to probe why police took an hour to respond to bashing 600m away

image.altText: Red and black flags with the acronym CMFEU flying in the wind.

props.synopsis: The commission of inquiry into alleged misconduct and corruption within the state division of the CFMEU is holding its second block of public hearings in Brisbane.

title.children: CFMEU inquiry to hear about 'orchestrated campaign' from rival union boss

image.altText: A mug shot of a man with dark hair and a beard.

props.synopsis: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, has pleaded not guilty to first-degree murder and assault charges.

title.children: Man charged in National Guard shooting pleads not guilty from hospital bed

image.altText: Anika Wells in white.

props.synopsis: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

title.children: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with two dogs

props.synopsis: Former nurse Rajwinder Singh has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley in Far North Queensland in October 2018.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley's accused killer wanted to be 'needle in a haystack', court told

image.altText: Bruce walks outside, flanked by others, wearing a blue suit, white shirt and pink tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: A decision in Bruce Lehrmann's Federal Court appeal to the findings in his failed defamation case against Network Ten will be handed down tomorrow — and whatever the outcome, there will be consequences for all.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann to learn fate of defamation case Federal Court appeal

image.altText: Three white ships sail very close to each other near an island with sharp rocky cliffs covered in trees

props.synopsis: Tokyo and Beijing have given different accounts of the clash as relations between the two countries continue to sour following comments made by Japan's prime minister about Taiwan.

title.children: Japan and China trade accusations after coast guard incident in disputed waters

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

title.children: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero

image.altText: Mark Mudie wears a blue shirt and is smiling with the Australian flag in the background

props.synopsis: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

title.children: Deputy shire president killed trying to protect family farm from fire

image.altText: Prada loge reads simply 'prada'

props.synopsis: The move is expected to revive Versace’s fortunes, after middling post-pandemic performance as part of the US luxury group Capri Holdings.

title.children: Prada buys fashion rival Versace in $2.2bn deal
